channel.title: Morning Cybersecurity
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Cybersecurity examines the latest news in cybersecurity policy and politics.

item.title: Hospitals in the cyber crosshairs
item.description: While ransomware gangs are betting that health care providers will pay to keep patients safe, the cyber community is warning of the grave risks of attacks on hospitals — and highlighting what providers are getting right.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Paging Dr. Deepfake
item.description: Cybercriminals are using AI tools to impersonate doctors online and cash out on pushing fake medications.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: States feel the cyber burn
item.description: The House Homeland Security Committee Chair is sounding the alarm on increasing cyber threats to state and local governments, as state IT leaders are feeling the impact of major cuts to federal cyber grants and services.
item.dc:creator: By Maggie Miller

item.title: Cybercrime crackdown goes global
item.description: Cybercrime syndicates across Southeast Asia are estimated to rake in billions from unsuspecting victims each year. Now, governments around the world are banding together to fight back.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Testing US election security
item.description: Several U.S. states, including New York, New Jersey and Virginia, are holding closely watched elections this November. But recent shakeups in voting technology and federal election resources may test the security and integrity of these votes.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: North Korean scammers go global
item.description: As U.S. law enforcement and cyber groups are cracking down on a years-long North Korean cyber scheme, these scammers are setting their sights on broader — potentially less savvy — targets across the world.
item.dc:creator: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel
item.dc:contributor: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel

item.title: How online crime became a national security crisis
item.description: As cyber scams are being linked to U.S. adversaries more and more, industry leaders and government officials are calling for renewed focus on robust federal policy to address cybercrime, scams and fraud.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Cyber shutdown showdown
item.description: With less than two days left before the deadline to fund the federal government, we break down how federal cyber agencies are preparing for a government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel
item.dc:contributor: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel
